description:
What's the best thing you can do with a piece of paper?

I'm not talking about paper planes or dragons (or even Mr. Napkin Head).
The elegant art of paper folding can be harnessed to perform
surprisingly powerful calculations. From a handful of basic folding
axioms, we will construct computational systems to solve a wide range of
problems. Starting with basic arithmetic operations, we will build up to
tackling cubic equations and even proofs of irrationality.

I'll be simulating the fold sequences in a custom Python library, but
feel free to bring a sheet of paper to follow along.
title: Computational Origami
